Data: 10am: England win the toss and bat, there's no - *intake of breath* - Graeme Swann or Steven Finn in their XI. Swann pulled up with a sore back, with Finn left out on grounds of form. James Tredwell plays, as does Ravi Bopara, so England have already abandoned their five batsmen, five seamers masterplan in their first game of the tournament.

10.10am: Okay, have you updated your Ashes swingometer, then? An injury to Swann (though we don't know how serious it is) will cause a shiver down the spine of many England fans but Tredwell is a very capable deputy, as he showed against New Zealand the other day, as well as in the fifth Australia ODI last summer.

10.20am: Australia, it should be remembered, have won their last six ODIs, including a whitewash of West Indies; they'll be hoping to chip away at England's still-fragile confidence in this format, as New Zealand did to good effect over the last week. As far as Ashes omens go, if Bailey and co can engineer a surprise victory, it may well carry echoes of the mee

10.25am: The teams are strolling out for the anthems, a few sparklers having just gone off on the outfield. For apple types, at this juncture I'd like to point you in the direction of our new iPhone app, available from the iTunes store. Click, click, click.
By the way, you can also follow the match with Gnasher on our social scorecard. It's got graphs, tweets and whizzy stuff like that.
Mitchell Starc has the ball in hand, Alastair Cook standing tall... are you ready for this? Hang on, Cook isn't, there's someone moving behind the bowler's arm. Tum-ti-tum. Let's try again...
Starc to Cook, FOUR runs overpitched on leg stump, nice juicy volley to begin with from Starc and Cook clumps it through backward square with relish, to raucous cheering from around the ground
Starc to Cook, no run good length, in the channel outside off stump, much better line and Cook shoulders arms as it shapes away
Starc to Cook, 1 run full and sliding on to the pads again, worked finer, towards long leg, Cook wants two but they decide against doing anything silly
Starc to Bell, no run angled across on a good length outside off stump, good carry through to the keeper as Bell leaves
Starc to Bell, no run back of a length and at the body, tapped short into the leg side
Starc to Bell, no run pitched up, around the line of off, Bell opens the face and steers into the gully
Johnson to Cook, no run in the channel outside off, better first ball from this Mitch, Cook leaves
Johnson to Cook, no run slightly overpitched, again a little leg side, shovelled towards backward square
Johnson to Cook, no run fullish and shaping nicely around off stump, gets across and shows it the face in defence
Johnson to Cook, no run full and holding its line on off stump, again Cook gets his bat down in time
Johnson to Cook, no run lovely delivery from Johnson, angled in on a testing length and nipping away as Cook prods at it and is beaten
Johnson to Cook, 1 run back of a length and wide, opens the arms and cracks a cut shot down to third man for a single to deny Mitch a maiden
Starc to Cook, no run on the pads, slightly full but Cook can't tuck it away this time

Starc to Cook, (no ball) 2 runs confusion, appeals, overthrows, chaos! Starc oversteps to concede a no-ball and Cook then has to scramble back to just beat a direct hit from point, Bell had gone charging down the pitch anyway, the ball deflects through midwicket after clipping the bails and they pick up a couple anyway
Starc to Cook, 2 runs pitched up, Cook goes for a heave straight out of the farmyard, so agricultural was it, more air than distance but it clears mid-off for a couple
Starc to Cook, 1 run edged, Cook pushes with hard hands but gets enough bat on it to take it wide of second slip for a single to third man
Starc to Bell, no run goes back and across to defend a shortish ball outside off
Starc to Bell, FOUR runs full and wide, angled across Bell who steps out and elegantly laces four through the covers, super timing
Starc to Bell, no run short of a length, on the stumps and defended from the crease
Johnson to Cook, no run full and wide and beats Cook driving, it swung a touch though it was probably one to be leaving at this stage, even in one-day mode
Johnson to Cook, no run cracked off the back foot towards point, plenty of power on the shot but David Warner makes a customarily smart stop
Johnson to Cook, 2 runs Cook gets forward and clips firmly off his front pad through midwicket, touch too full and straight again from Johnson
Johnson to Cook, 1 run pitched up a foot or so outside off, Cook chops down on it and the ball squirts through midwicket
Johnson to Bell, 1 run sharp bouncer from Johnson, he's working up decent pace and this gets big on Bell, who thrusts his hands at it and does well to keep it down towards gully
Johnson to Cook, no run pitched up outside the line of off, textbook front-foot drive from Cook but he picks mid-off
McKay to Bell, no run gets his radar functioning, homing in around off stump and blocked
McKay to Bell, no run nipping back off the surface, wide of the stumps and Bell is happy to leave
McKay to Bell, 2 runs full, slightly wide and Bell skips forward lightly to loft the ball over extra cover, not perfectly timed but they get a couple into the deep
McKay to Bell, FOUR runs overpitched again, Bell drives uppishly but into a gap, this has more middle about it and beats the chasing fielder to the extra cover boundary
McKay to Bell, no run length delivery in the channel, not doing much off the straight and Bell shoulders arms
McKay to Bell, no run driving again and edged but it doesn't carry, the ball bouncing a few inches in front of a sprawling second slip
Johnson to Cook, no run back of a length, outside off and flayed off the back foot, picks out point though
Johnson to Cook, no run tighter line and blocked into the leg side
Johnson to Cook, 2 runs full, veering towards leg stump, glanced in front of square by Cook and the back on the boundary covers good ground to prevent a boundary
Johnson to Cook, 1 leg bye again that low, slingy action sends the ball tailing towards leg, misses with a clip this time and it rolls away off the pad
Johnson to Bell, no run fired across on a good length, going on with the arm, Bell lets it through
Johnson to Bell, no run pitched up around middle and off, Bell taps respectfully back down the pitch
McKay to Cook, 1 run full, drifting on to the pads, it's not swinging and another single is milked through square leg
McKay to Bell, 1 run touch short and steered through point of the back foot
McKay to Cook, no run pitched up around off stump, played towards mid-off coming forward
McKay to Cook, no run full and straight again, this comes off somewhere nearer the toe of the bat and rolls to mid-off
McKay to Cook, no run better length, around off stump, blocked back down the track
Johnson to Bell, no run that's an excellent line from Johnson to Bell, speared across and lifting sharply, the batsman has his off stump covered but is drawn into a bit of a flirt anyway
Johnson to Bell, 1 leg bye straighter, attempts to tuck off his pads but doesn't get any bat on it

Johnson to Cook, FOUR runs Johnson gets the boundary treatment now, full and wide of the stumps, the ball isn't doing anything threatening through the air or off the pitch and Cook confidently punches another four through the covers
Johnson to Cook, 1 run gets across and tucks one through square leg
Johnson to Bell, 1 run another well-directed bumper, Bell jerks his bat up in front of his face and the ball flies off the handle in the air through backward square leg
Johnson to Cook, 2 runs slung down around leg stump, Cook waits on it and squirrels another couple behind square on the leg side
McKay to Bell, no run length delivery outside off, blocked coming forward
McKay to Bell, 1 run slashes with a slightly angled bat, playing away from his body and a thick edge runs down to third man
McKay to Cook, no run pitched up around the line of off, punched back towards mid-off
McKay to Cook, no run pushed across, again probably a touch full, Cook doesn't time his drive towards the man at extra cover

McKay to Cook, no run length ball, angled across but offering Cook width, he scythes the bat through a meaty cut but Warner pulls off a terrific diving stop to take the ball on the bounce and save his side a boundary
McKay to Cook, no run line and length outside off, stands tall and taps square
Watson to Bell, FOUR runs woof, there's nothing too dazzling about that from the bowler's point of view, wide half-volley and Bell spanks it straight back past Watson for a howdy-do-dee four
Watson to Bell, no run better length, comes forward and defends around off
Watson to Bell, 1 run worked wide of mid-on, they scamper a quick one, despite the direct hit at the striker's end
Watson to Cook, 1 run sliding across the left-hander from over the wicket, opens the face and steers one to third man
Watson to Bell, 2 runs full and wide of the stumps, Bell waits, crouches and angles a couple through gully, it's wide of third man and they get back for two
Watson to Bell, no run pitched up in the channel and driven towards mid-off
McKay to Cook, 1 run pitched up in the corridor (of absolute certainty today, it would appear), Cook drives and a thickish edge runs to third man
McKay to Bell, 1 run goes back and across and glides a single down to third man
McKay to Cook, no run full and straight, the bat turns in Cook's hands as he tries to push back down the wicket
McKay to Cook, no run good, probing line, not too full and Cook is only half forward, gets an inside edge on to his pad
McKay to Cook, no run maintains that diligent line around middle and off, again defended coming forward
McKay to Cook, no run slightly wider, on a length and blocked into the covers
Watson to Bell, no run touch short of a good length, defended on the back foot outside off
Watson to Bell, 1 run dug in, straighter line, this sits up and pulls comfortably for a single down towards fine leg
Watson to Cook, no run stays in the crease and plays towards point

Watson to Cook, OUT he's done it, Watson makes the breakthrough, drawing Cook into a drive to be caught behind! Cook will feel he should have pinged that through the covers, it was a little wide, on a good length but they've not had any problems hitting on the up this morning - just a thin snick of bat and Cook trudges off having made another solid start
Watson to Trott, no run length ball in the corridor outside off stump, gets across to defend
Watson to Trott, no run angling in towards middle and off, worked off the front pad straight to midwicket
McKay to Bell, 1 run length delivery outside off, sits back and dabs one to third man
McKay to Trott, no run McKay lets out a grunt of effort in sending down a gun-barrel straight delivery outside off, Trott leaves it alone
McKay to Trott, 1 run touch shorter, goes across and flicks with a turn of the wrists out to deep midwicket
McKay to Bell, no run pitched up outside the line of off, defended
McKay to Bell, no run off-stump line, gets forward to block short on the off side

McKay to Bell, 1 leg bye hit on the pad walking across his stumps, McKay lets out a lone gargle of an appeal - probably sliding down leg, though the replay shows it to have been a pretty close call, maybe tickling the top of the stump
Watson to Bell, 2 runs on the stumps, goes across and turns through square leg for a couple with a closed bat face
Watson to Bell, no run shortens his length, Bell covers his stumps in defence
Watson to Bell, no run gets forward and blocks into the off side
Watson to Bell, 1 run strays towards leg stump, flicked off the pads for a single to fine leg
Watson to Trott, no run good length, Trott edges across and gets a leading edge towards mid-on trying to glance square
Watson to Trott, no run length delivery, coming in with the arm, Trott gets outside the line of off stump and there's both bat and pad involved, Marais Erasmus shaking his head at Watson's appeal
Starc to Bell, 1 run short and angled across, waits in the crease and dabs a single to third man
Starc to Bell, 2 runs pitched up outside off and lofted over the man brought in at short extra cover, lands between mid-off and cover but doesn't go all the way
Starc to Bell, 1 run gets forward and drives a full-length delivery through square to the man on the fence
Starc to Trott, no run straighter line, defended into the leg side from in front of off stump
Starc to Trott, no run angled across, Trott comes forward and punches a half-volley to mid-off
Watson to Bell, no run on a length at off stump, defended to the off side
Watson to Bell, no run fuller this time, punched very firmly straight and it bursts through Watson's in his follow through but mid-off is able to get around
Watson to Bell, 1 run dragged down short, Bell is coming forward then rocks back to pull through square leg
Watson to Trott, 1 run short again, Trott whip-pulls it off his hip out to deep square-leg
Watson to Bell, no run in the air...but short of mid-on. Bell came forward to drive and was a fraction early on the shot, the ball carried about two-thirds of the way towards the fielder
Watson to Bell, no run full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
Starc to Trott, no run touch of width outside off but Trott picks out backward point as he drives off the back foot
Starc to Trott, no run fuller and closer to off stump, Trott shuffles across the crease and works it to mid-on
Starc to Trott, no run whipped with a strong bottom from outside off to mid-on
Starc to Trott, FOUR runs lovely placement and timing, Trott came forward to a good length ball angled across him and places it perfectly between cover and point...basically just touched the ball
Starc to Trott, no run short ball outside off stump, Trott drops his hands and lets it through
Starc to Trott, no run short again and a little wider outside off, Trott lets it go through to Wade
Faulkner to Bell, 1 run full and outside off, Bell drives into the off side but without any great timing
Faulkner to Trott, 1 run waits for this outside off, opens the face and runs it past the very wide slip down to third man
Faulkner to Bell, no run forward on off stump, defended square into the off side
Faulkner to Bell, 2 leg byes short of a length, Bell goes a long way across his crease and it flicks his thigh pad towards fine leg
Faulkner to Bell, 2 runs slower ball on the stumps, neatly tucked off the pads through square leg with just the placement to allow him back for a second
Faulkner to Bell, no run touch of extra bounce, lifts from quite a full length and catches Bell by surprise but he's able to take the bottom hand off the bat as he defends
Starc to Trott, 1 run plenty of width, Trott stretches well forward and drives strong through the off side to the cover sweeper
Starc to Bell, 1 run shorter delivery, comes very slowly off the surface and Bell has to hold his shot for a second before placing it through the off side
Starc to Trott, 1 run placed into the off side, it beats Warner who goes one-handed for the stop and doesn't quite get down to the ball
Starc to Bell, no run defended off the back foot to cover
Starc to Bell, 1 run stands tall and drives this off the back foot to the cover sweeper
Starc to Trott, no run fuller on middle and off, Bell walks into his defensive shot which finds cover
Faulkner to Bell, 1 run full on the stumps, Bell steps across the crease and works it through straight midwicket
Faulkner to Trott, no run wider outside off, defended square to backward point
Faulkner to Trott, no run sensing a build-up of the pressure, Trott comes down the pitch and outside leg to try and make room through the off side but Faulker fires it wider outside off
Faulkner to Trott, no run short of a length, takes Trott high above the pads and drops by his feet
Faulkner to Trott, 1 run worked from well outside off through square leg...Trott's bottom hand taking over again
Faulkner to Bell, 1 run placed neatly through the off side from the front foot
Voges to Bell, no run round the wicket, full on off stump, driven straight to cover
Voges to Bell, no run a little shorter, Bell rocks back and cuts but picks out backward point
Voges to Bell, 2 runs paddle-sweeps this from outside off through backward square leg
Voges to Bell, 2 runs lovely off-side drive, placed wide of the cover sweeper but he manages to get around the boundary
Voges to Bell, no run very full, dug out into the off side and Voges comes across from his follow through
Voges to Bell, no run this one skids through outside off and goes under the bottom edge of Bell's bat as he tries to cut
Faulkner to Trott, 1 run full and wide outside off, Trott strides forward and drives to the sweeper who is a busy man at the moment

Faulkner to Bell, FOUR runs dragged down shot, poor delivery on a slow pitch, and Bell pulls it through midwicket...not quite out of the middle but has enough to beat deep square-leg running around the boundary
Faulkner to Bell, no run back on a full length, driven firmly to cover
Faulkner to Bell, no run the bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives a fraction early, the ball goes in the air for a while but falls well short of point
Faulkner to Bell, 1 run a delicate late cut to third man
Faulkner to Trott, no run tries to work this from outside off through the leg side but only gets it back to Faulkner
Voges to Bell, no run gently floated up outside off, patted back to Voges
Voges to Bell, no run tossed up very full, Bell can only dig it out to the off side
Voges to Bell, no run on middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
Voges to Bell, 1 run drives with an open face and it beats cover who dives over the ball
Voges to Trott, 1 run a touch shorter, worked off the back foot through the leg side
Voges to Bell, 1 run full on off, driven down the ground, and that's his fifty...he needs to build on this
Faulkner to Bell, no run opens the face and finds backward point
Faulkner to Bell, 1 run driven firmly just to the left of mid-off who is fairly deep
Faulkner to Trott, 2 runs offers some width to Trott who drives strongly square of the wicket, backward point dives but can't pull off the stop
Faulkner to Trott, 1 run goes right across outside off and works it through midwicket
Faulkner to Bell, 1 run neat, punchy drive straight down the pitch...mid-off moves to his right but there's an easy single
Faulkner to Trott, no run worked to mid-on
Voges to Bell, 2 runs swept from outside off through square leg
Voges to Bell, 1 run floated up on off stump, driven carefully down the ground to long-off
Voges to Trott, 1 run driven down to long-on
Voges to Bell, 1 run pat, pat, pat...this one is again pushed down the ground
Voges to Trott, 1 run full on leg stump, flicked out to deep square-leg
Voges to Bell, no run gets away with a low full toss which Bell flicks straight to midwicket
Johnson to Trott, no run full at off stump, defended back to Johnson
Johnson to Trott, 1 run tucked through his favourite area at midwicket from outside off
Johnson to Bell, 1 run full outside off, driven out to deep cover
Johnson to Trott, 1 run worked from the off stump through the leg side again...tick, tick, tick by this pair
Johnson to Bell, no run outside off, angled across Bell who leaves alone...goes on the second bounce to Wade
Johnson to Bell, 1 run dropped in short, Bell hops back and pulls firmly in front of square
Watson to Bell, 1 run full on off stump, opens the face and places it through backward point
Watson to Trott, 1 run width outside off, angled down to third man
Watson to Bell, no run firmly driven behind square where backward point cuts it off
Watson to Bell, no run punched back to the bowler, Bell started to advance but couldn't manufacture anything
Watson to Bell, no run beaten outside off, a cutter from Watson, grips a little off the surface and goes over the top edge as Bell tries to run to third man
Watson to Bell, 1 run angled to backward point who makes a full-length dive, but parries the ball away so it's a single anyway
Johnson to Bell, FOUR runs some aggression from Bell as he drives a full, wide delivery over the top of backward point and he places it well enough to beat the boundary sweeper
Johnson to Bell, no run a spanking drive from Bell but it rockets straight to cover
Johnson to Bell, no run full and wide, going across Bell who chases it with out off drive but doesn't make contact
Johnson to Bell, no run he's feeding Bell's off-side strokes at the moment but he again picks out backward point
Johnson to Bell, 1 run a short ball that sits in the surface and Bell pulls it down to towards fine leg
Johnson to Trott, no run played out to backward point
Watson to Bell, no run beaten as he tries to cut...Watson's style very much suited to this surface
Watson to Bell, 2 leg byes goes right across his stumps and tickles it fine past the keeper off the pad
Watson to Bell, 1 run chopped down to third man
Watson to Trott, 1 run punched off the back foot through the gap at cover
Watson to Bell, FOUR runs very nicely done by Bell, delicate and deliberate as he uses his wrists to run this very fine down to third man who can't get around
Watson to Bell, 1 run worked from off stump into the leg side
Johnson to Bell, FOUR runs short ball and Bell top edges his pull straight over the wicketkeeper...extra pace did for Bell, but the end result good for England
Johnson to Bell, 1 run looks as though he's trying to push on now, a low full toss, slower ball, outside off and the bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives to drive...gets a single through square
Johnson to Trott, 1 run placed through the off side
Johnson to Bell, 1 run short again, Bell is more comfortable with this one as he pulls in front of square

Johnson to Trott, 2 runs good placement and good running...Trott worked this from outside off through fine leg and quickly spotted the chance for a second. It was tight, but he was well back in the end
Johnson to Trott, 1 run more swift running, pushed towards mid-off and he scampers...10 from the over
Marsh to Trott, no run full on middle and off, worked towards mid-on
Marsh to Trott, 1 run worked through square leg
Marsh to Bell, 1 run on leg stump, flicked in the air wide of the midwicket fielder inside the circle
Marsh to Trott, 1 wide pushed down the leg side
Marsh to Trott, 1 run full on middle and whipped to long leg
Marsh to Bell, 1 run dropped in his follow through by Marsh...quite a tough one to his right, Bell pushed early at the ball
Marsh to Trott, 2 runs going across his stumps again, worked wide of Wade who then chases after it but can't prevent them coming back for a second
Starc to Bell, 1 run full at off stump, pushed firmly towards mid-off
Starc to Trott, no run on middle and off, played to backward point
Starc to Trott, 2 runs lovely cover drive by Trott as he leans into the ball, placed just to the right of the sweeper
Starc to Trott, 1 wide a bouncer from Starc and it's too wide for the umpires
Starc to Trott, no run wide outside off, Trott's drive comes off a thick inside edge to the leg side
Starc to Trott, 2 runs short ball, quite well directed, but Trott gets inside the line and pulls wide of long leg

Starc to Trott, 2 runs neatly worked through midwicket off the back foot, well placed between the fielders and another well-judged couple. Brings up the hundred stand between these two on their home ground
Marsh to Bell, 1 wide down the leg side, another extra to the tally
Marsh to Bell, 1 run back outside off and driven through the covers
Marsh to Trott, no run taken from outside off to midwicket
Marsh to Trott, 1 run a full delivery outside off is bunted towards mid-on who is too deep to stop the single
Marsh to Bell, no run nicely timed straight down the pitch but Marsh gets his right hand to it in his follow through
Marsh to Bell, 1 run quick single into the off side
Marsh to Trott, 2 runs back of a length, Trott works it off his hip and again the placement is good, wide of long leg, to make it a comfortable two
Starc to Bell, 1 run pushed across outside off, opens the face to find third man
Starc to Trott, 2 runs full outside off, dug out through square cover and it's place to the left of the sweeper
Starc to Trott, 2 runs short ball outside off, it's another brace as he pulls through square leg
Starc to Trott, OUT there's the breakthrough for Australia...Trott chases a wide ball outside off and gets a thin edge through to Wade
Starc to Root, 1 run short of a length, he opens the face and gets off the mark to third

Starc to Bell, 1 run close! Pushed into the off side by Bell who sets off straight away for the single and Root needs to get the dive out as the throw comes in, but it misses the stumps by quite some distance
Watson to Bell, no run on middle, defended to the off side
Watson to Bell, 1 run dabbed down to third man
Watson to Root, no run short of a length, he gets an inside edge into his body
Watson to Root, no run fuller this time, punched firmly to mid-off
Watson to Root, 1 leg bye he's early on his pull shot as this ball grips on the surface and it runs wide of backward point off his shoulder
Watson to Bell, 1 run opens the face to third man again...just three from that over
Starc to Bell, 1 run he stays in his comfort zone and runs this down to third man
Starc to Root, 1 run full outside off, driven through the covers but the sweeper keeps them to a single
Starc to Bell, 1 run very wide, Bell has to really reach for this and it comes off the toe end out to deep cover
Starc to Root, FOUR runs there's the invention from Root as he scoops a length ball over his shoulder and down to fine-leg...expertly played
Starc to Root, no run full on middle, pushed to cover
Starc to Root, no run back over the wicket now, and this is well bowled, touch of extra bounce beats Root's top edge
McKay to Bell, 1 run he's across the crease and takes this from outside off towards mid-on
McKay to Root, 1 run flicked through the leg side, like Bell he shuffles across the crease and uses his bottom hand to help find the gap
McKay to Bell, 1 run uses his feet to come at McKay, it's a back-of-a-length delivery which he just tucks to the right of midwicket
McKay to Root, 1 run moves to leg to give himself some room but can only place this towards backward point
McKay to Bell, 1 run short of a length, Bell turns it through square leg
McKay to Root, 1 run slower delivery which is dragged down short, Root tries to wait for it but can still only pull the ball straight to deep square...a good Powerplay over from McKay
Faulkner to Root, no run bringing out another of his range of strokes as he tries to reverse scoop over third man but fails to make contact
Faulkner to Root, no run full on leg stump, squeezed to midwicket
Faulkner to Root, 3 runs flicked away off leg stump, nicely placed between long leg and deep square, Voges gets around to prevent the boundary but his flick to McKay is fumbled and it allows a third
Faulkner to Bell, OUT full and straight, Bell gets cleaned up so he won't have a hometown hundred...Bell suggests the ball didn't bounce as he expected, but I just think he missed a straight one
Faulkner to Morgan, no run outside off and left alone
Faulkner to Morgan, no run comes forward on off stump and defends to cover
McKay to Root, no run on off stump, played to point
McKay to Root, no run again he can't find a gap as he pushes this square into the off side
McKay to Root, OUT back to back wickets, Root clips a delivery from off stump straight to midwicket...Australia now making some significant inroads
McKay to Bopara, no run defended to the off side
McKay to Bopara, no run full at off stump, played to cover again...one for a wicket maiden here
McKay to Bopara, 1 run it won't quite be a maiden as he gets off the mark with a single to third man, but that was an excellent over from McKay
Faulkner to Bopara, 2 runs flicked in the air off leg stump but it's wide of midwicket and also wide of deep square
Faulkner to Bopara, no run on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
Faulkner to Bopara, 2 runs very full on off stump, jabbed down towards third man and Bopara does very well to spot the chance for a second
Faulkner to Bopara, no run slower ball on off stump, Bopara comes forward and pushes to the off side
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run pushed square into the off side...Australia content to concede singles
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run worked through midwicket to get off the mark
McKay to Morgan, no run slightly full, on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
McKay to Morgan, 1 run short of a length and angled across in the channel, waits and dabs one through gully
McKay to Bopara, no run full and outside off, chops down and squeezes the ball towards cover point
McKay to Bopara, 1 run again pitches the ball up in the channel, Bopara opens the face and thins a single down to third man
McKay to Morgan, 1 run shortish, on leg stump, comes off pad and glove, I think, short on the leg side and they nick another
McKay to Bopara, no run pitched up and played back to the bowler
Faulkner to Morgan, no run good length ball around off stump, blocked back to the bowler
Faulkner to Morgan, 2 runs slides down the leg side, whips the ball off a length through backward square, wide of the man in the deep
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run goes back and across and worked through backward point for one
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 leg bye stays over the wicket to the right-hander, pitched outside leg stump, tries to glance and gets a single fine off the pad
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run full and wide and chopped into the ground on the off side

Faulkner to Bopara, 1 leg bye pitched up around leg stump, Faulkner appeals as the ball thumps Bopara's pad and rolls into the off side ... and Australia decide to review the not-out decision. And the replays show it landed and struck outside the line, so that's a DRS fail for Australia
McKay to Bopara, FOUR runs pitched up in the slot outside off stump and Bopara pays out, the fruits align and he skips forward to bunt the ball over long-off, one-bounce four
McKay to Bopara, 1 run pushed into the covers for one coming forward
McKay to Morgan, 1 run slower bouncer, outside off stump, Morgan waits and guides one to third man
McKay to Bopara, 1 run bends his back and digs this in short over the top of the stumps, Bopara drops it at his toes and they're alert to scamper a single

McKay to Morgan, OUT shuffles across and bowled round his legs! McKay suckers him, maybe took the pace off a touch, Morgan going right across and exposing middle and leg stump, tried to wristily flick the ball over backward square leg, missed and the ball hit
McKay to Buttler, 1 run very full and straight, gets the bat down in time and clips through square leg to get off the mark first ball

Faulkner to Buttler, OUT and Buttler's gone second ball, edging on to his stumps! Good areas from Faulkner, not quite wide or full enough for the drive and Buttler played away from his body, not much footwork, the ball cannoning back into his standing leg and then on to middle stump - the gunpowder has exploded in England's face!
Faulkner to Bresnan, no run angled across on the full, played back towards the bowler
Faulkner to Bresnan, no run full and outside off, driven hard along the ground straight to mid-off
Faulkner to Bresnan, no run slower ball, Bresnan pushes forward and the ball loops short on the off side
Faulkner to Bresnan, 1 run tip and run towards mid-off, slightly to one side of Warner but he collects cleanly and a direct hit might have seen Bresnan struggling
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run slightly too leg side, flicks a length delivery off the pads to fine leg
McKay to Bopara, no run full and in the channel outside off, driven into the off side, can't beat the infield
McKay to Bopara, 1 run hangs back and glides a length delivery towards third man
McKay to Bresnan, no run full and outside off, gets a stride in a drills the ball straight to extra cover
McKay to Bresnan, no run length, dabs the ball towards point
McKay to Bresnan, 1 leg bye legcutter from Mckay and this surprises Bresnan, who was through his shot and is then hit on the arm trying to flinch out of the way
McKay to Bopara, 1 run line and length outside off, dabs a single behind point
Faulkner to Bopara, FOUR runs full and on the pads, only needs a tickle from Bopara's bat to send it skipping away to fine leg for a welcome boundary
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 wide slower ball out the back of the hand, this spins like a chinaman past Bopara and is called wide
Faulkner to Bopara, no run good length and angled across, beats Bopara's waft
Faulkner to Bopara, 2 runs waits on a length ball, maybe slower again, works it into a gap at square leg for a couple
Faulkner to Bopara, no run hangs back and defends short on the leg side, Faulkner collects in his follow through
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run goes round the wicket, another change of pace, tapped behind square on the off side for another single
Faulkner to Bresnan, 1 run edges across the stumps and flicks a full-length ball angling in towards deep backward square
Starc to Bresnan, FOUR runs round the wicket, dug in short, the pace seems to surprise Bresnan, who jerks his bat across the line and manages to divert a top edge out towards fine leg
Starc to Bresnan, FOUR runs consecutive boundaries, this behind square on the off side as Bresnan launches into a drive and slices a full delivery wide of third man
Starc to Bresnan, 1 run angled in and whipped off the pads through backward square
Starc to Bopara, 2 runs low full toss, Bopara swats at it, gets a healthy edge and Wade does very well to get a glove on it as the ball skims past, ensuring third man can clean up
Starc to Bopara, 1 run pitched up on the stumps, tapped back through mid-on for a single
Starc to Bresnan, no run full, yorker-length outside off, Bresnan can only jam his bat down on it
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run round the wicket, full and tailing in, worked between mid-on and midwicket for a single to the sweeper
Faulkner to Bresnan, no run gets the ball right up in the blockhole and Bresnan is forced to dig it out
Faulkner to Bresnan, 1 run good stuff from Faulkner, getting his yorkers in, this one squirts out into the off side
Faulkner to Bopara, 2 runs full and on the pads, flicked wristily in the air in front of the man at deep midwicket for a couple
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run keeps the ball right up towards the crease, Bopara brings the bat down and inside-edges behind square
Faulkner to Bresnan, 1 run full and pitching around leg stump, clears the front leg and drives to long-on
Starc to Bresnan, 2 runs full and angled in from round the wicket, squeezed out behind square on the leg side, they get back for two
Starc to Bresnan, 2 runs Bresnan frees the arms and bunts a fullish ball past the diving fielder at midwicket, he's not far off making a stupendous catch but they get a couple more
Starc to Bresnan, 1 run backing away outside leg stump, opens the shoulders and drives one into the covers

Starc to Bopara, SIX runs bosh, this one goes all the way, England's first six of the innings! A low full toss from Starc, Bopara clips it unfussily over deep midwicket, not much follow through but it flies low into the crowd
Starc to Bopara, 2 runs dabs this into a gap through square leg and they run hard to get back for a second
Starc to Bopara, no run full bunger, Bopara can't get under this one and Starc ends his allocation with a dot
Johnson to Bresnan, 1 run goes for the yorker wide of the stumps, Bresnan manages to work it away for a single through cover

Johnson to Bopara, 2 runs slices this high, high into the off side, Bopara done by the slower ball as he tried to cart it back down the ground, it swirled above Bailey in the covers, he didn't get under it and then failed to get a finger on the attempted catch too!
Johnson to Bopara, 1 run fired across and Bopara swings hard, gets a toe end past Wade
Johnson to Bresnan, 1 wide sprayed very wide this time, as Bresnan stepped away - this one's called
Johnson to Bresnan, 1 leg bye dug in short, the batsman swings across the line and misses, hits the body and runs away behind square - these two have put on fifty in quick time

Johnson to Bopara, FOUR runs makes a calculated step across his stumps, Johnson pitches it up outside off and this is right under Bopara's nose, he middles it, smacked low straight back down the ground and it beats the diving long-off for another boundary

Johnson to Bopara, 1 run length ball, swung hard through midwicket but he picks out the the man in the deep and it's just a single to end a handy little cameo from Bopara and the innings with England 269 for 6

4.25pm: So, around 25 minutes late, the England innings ends (expect a potential fine for Australia due to the over rate) - and both sides will probably talk up their respective positions. England might have made more, given the start their top three gave them, but will feel that total is defendable. Australia pulled it back with some disciplined bowling in the
Hello everyone, hope you've had a nice lunch, Alex Winter with you for the start of the second innings with James Anderson about to get us underway from the Pavilion End...
Anderson to Warner, no run full of length just outside off stump, left alone
Anderson to Warner, no run a little further outside off and left again
Anderson to Warner, no run much tighter to off stump and well left, decent judgement of the off stump
Anderson to Warner, no run similar area, Warner leaves alone once again, reins himself in again
Anderson to Warner, 2 runs plays at this and forces away in front of point from a foot outside off, a strong punch
Anderson to Warner, no run fuller length and Warner comes forward just outside off and shoulders arms
Broad to Watson, no run full towards off stump, Watson gets down low to drive, doesn't time it and gets it up to mid-off
Broad to Watson, no run more of a length ball and a touch tighter to off stump, blocked in the crease back up the wicket
Broad to Watson, no run blocked in the crease again, runs this out from an inch or two outside off square on the off side
Broad to Watson, no run fuller ball, Watson comes a long way forward a foot outside off to block back to the bowler
Broad to Watson, 2 runs a touch straighter and Watson able to flick past midwicket for a couple, didn't get all of it and did play somewhat across the line, taken from off stump that with the angle
Broad to Watson, 1 run another press into the leg side and beats Anderson at mid-on for a quick single, it was just to his right, taken from around off stump on a decent length again
Anderson to Watson, no run forward just outside off and pushed to the short extra cover
Anderson to Watson, 1 run fuller on middle stump, clipped out effortlessly to deep square leg, timed the pants off that
Anderson to Warner, 1 run fails to adjust for the left-hander and bowls a leg stump ball on a length that is tucked down to long leg
Anderson to Watson, 1 run finds deep square leg again with a well-timed flick off middle and off
Anderson to Warner, no run full on the off stump, a hint of inswing, pushed to mid-on
Anderson to Warner, 1 leg bye catches him on the pad and runs fine of square leg for a single, full delivery on leg stump that Warner missed trying to play into the on side

Broad to Warner, FOUR runs just back of a length and tucked away past square leg, goodness that is well timed and beats Trott at long leg, seemed like just a nudge but he flicked it away with enough power
Broad to Warner, no run back of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover on the back foot
Broad to Warner, no run a little straight and tucked to long leg whose up in the circle and dives and saves four, very good save
Broad to Warner, no run tries to cut but it's a bit close to him and got a bit big on him too, finds backward point off an under-edge
Broad to Warner, 1 run much fuller, ran from middle and leg wide of short long leg who runs back and to his right to save the second
Broad to Watson, 1 run off stump line and full, Watson gets forward and outside the line to push just wide of mid-on for a quick single
Anderson to Watson, no run off stump line on a good length, pushed forward into the covers
Anderson to Watson, 1 run flicked out to deep square leg again from a straighter, fuller ball
Anderson to Warner, no run decent length just outside off, it gets a little big on Warner again as he looks to play square on the off side, gets it to point
Anderson to Warner, 1 run middle and leg now and ran out through square leg to the fielder in the deep
Anderson to Watson, no run an inch outside off, Watson forward and plays with inner half of the bat to midwicket
Anderson to Watson, no run forward again on the off stump and Watson calmly blocks back to the bowler
Broad to Warner, no run and this is again tucking Warner up, off stump line on a length just blocked back to the bowler
Broad to Warner, no run an inch wider but Warner plays the same stroke, runs it out to short cover point
Broad to Warner, no run a touch fuller, driven on the front foot but not timed, gets it to mid-off
Broad to Warner, no run a touch short in length and Warner stays back and tries to forces through the off side, only finds cover

Broad to Warner, OUT fuller and driven at, edged to the keeper where Jos Buttler takes a fine catch to his left, no slip in place so that was an excellent grab diving with two hands. England have earned the wicket with their excellent start, a bit of width offered and Warner couldn't resist, flashing the hands at it without moving his feet and got a big n
Broad to Hughes, no run full and straight, dug out and runs it to second slip
Anderson to Watson, no run forward just outside off stump, pushed to point
Anderson to Watson, no run played in the same way forward just outside off stump
Anderson to Watson, 2 runs length ball, Watson stays in his crease and dabs down past slip to third man where Trott dives and saves well
Anderson to Watson, no run tries the same stroke but this tails in and Watson gets in a tangle trying to late cut and it comes off high on the bat towards cover
Anderson to Watson, no run similar line and length, played more conventionally this time to mid-on with a straight bat
Anderson to Watson, 1 run another length ball an inch or so outside off, Watson comfortable enough now to open the face and guide to third man
Broad to Watson, no run full ball, firm punch from just outside off stump to mid-off

Broad to Watson, no run driven again, comes back to Broad and he's actually claiming the catch, they're going upstairs to check, did Watson drive this into his boot? It was a good low catch from Broad, Watson was pushing forward but played it into the ground
Broad to Watson, no run straight and right up in the block-hole, well dug out

Broad to Watson, FOUR runs leading edge trying to play to leg and gets an edge to slip where Cook dives to his left and can't quite hang on, would have been a blinding catch but a moment of luck for Watson trying to flick to leg

Broad to Watson, 1 run forward press into the covers, sets off for a single and hesitates, then runs, then hesitates again and has to dive into his ground, an easy single was there but Watson nearly made a right horlicks of it
Broad to Hughes, FOUR runs length ball wide enough of off stump, driven nicely and gets it through cover point, lovely timing, foot movement right to the ball, excellent shot
Anderson to Watson, 1 run full and tails in towards middle and off, Watson goes to drive and doesn't time it but gets it wide of mid-on for a single
Anderson to Hughes, no run an foot outside off, not full enough to drive, just blocks into the covers

Anderson to Hughes, 1 run length ball that has Hughes defending awkwardly on the crease and it leaves him slightly and takes the shoulder of the bat through gully to third man, didn't know a great deal about that
Anderson to Watson, 3 runs driven through the covers, off low on the bat it seemed, doesn't race away and allows Bell and Bopara in tandem to save four
Anderson to Hughes, 1 run forward press just outside off into the covers
Anderson to Watson, no run we're back and Watson pushes forward just outside off towards backward point
Broad to Hughes, no run length ball just outside off stump, blocked back up the wicket from the crease
Broad to Hughes, no run cut through cover point, no it isn't, Morgan saves brilliantly with a flying dive and there's confusion in the running and Hughes is sent back having come half-way down
Broad to Hughes, no run loud cry for lbw as Hughes went to flick to leg, probably pitched outside leg, he hit it too, easy decision
Broad to Hughes, no run back and across the off stump in defence
Broad to Hughes, no run full and tails in and Hughes nearly gets outside it but forces to mid-on
Bresnan to Watson, 2 runs starts full on the stumps and gets flicked through square leg, it's wide of the sweeper so they get two
Bresnan to Watson, 1 run stays back and dabs behind square on the off side
Bresnan to Hughes, FOUR runs overpitched outside off and driven past extra cover, timed supremely well, that was a fine stroke, hands right out to the ball with a good stride down the wicket
Bresnan to Hughes, no run a little short now and pulled, square leg dives and saves well
Bresnan to Hughes, no run full again just outside off stump, pushed at and gets it to orthodox cover right on the edge of the circle
Bresnan to Hughes, no run stays back in the crease and cuts to backward point from a foot outside off
Tredwell to Watson, no run tossed up outside off, played towards short third man and there
Tredwell to Watson, no run goes to flick off the stumps to leg and it flicks the pad to short long leg
Tredwell to Watson, no run pushed off the stumps to midwicket on the front foot
Tredwell to Watson, no run played in the same fashion to the same fielder
Tredwell to Watson, no run shaped to try and pull but had to adjust and just block on off stump, didn't quite read the flight
Tredwell to Watson, 2 runs a little fuller and flicked through square leg, they run hard and it's in between deep backward square and deep midwicket so they take two
Bresnan to Hughes, no run length ball just outside off stump, pushed into a heavily-packed off side field
Bresnan to Hughes, no run shaped to play to leg and nearly played across but ended up blocking up the wicket around off stump
Bresnan to Hughes, no run played from a length around off stump into the gully

Bresnan to Hughes, 1 run played a bit firmer into the gully and is this another tough chance to Cook? It went ever so quickly to him from a flashing blade and it carried again to his diving left-hand but again he couldn't cling on to what would have been a pearler
Bresnan to Watson, 1 leg bye goes to flick to leg and it comes off the thigh pad towards square leg
Bresnan to Hughes, 1 run just outside off, stays in the crease and opens the face down to third man
Tredwell to Hughes, no run very full on off stump, pushed to short extra-cover
Tredwell to Hughes, no run played forward on off stump again, fiddled into the covers
Tredwell to Hughes, no run forward again, pressed into the covers once more
Tredwell to Hughes, no run more flight, driven hard to short extra-cover
Tredwell to Hughes, no run drops a little shorter, Hughes goes back and cuts but only to short extra cover again
Tredwell to Hughes, no run takes a step down the wicket and plays out to point, a single not available
Bresnan to Watson, no run length ball a foot outside off, goes to late cut and plays and misses
Bresnan to Watson, no run gets the late cut away this time but Cook gets down quickly to his right and saves very well, very sharp in there

Bresnan to Watson, OUT full ball on the stumps, huge appeal for lbw, the ball cannons to gully where Cook takes the catch, either way Watson's out and he's caught, having got a thin edge onto the front pad that looped up to Cook. The delivery tailed in a little and Watson got outside the line and overbalanced
Bresnan to Bailey, no run tails in again, struck too high on the pad for an lbw call
Bresnan to Bailey, no run played off the back foot towards backward point
Bresnan to Bailey, no run straight through him, Bailey late in getting the bat down on a defensive stroke around off stump, got well beaten and the ball narrowly went over off stump
Tredwell to Hughes, no run tossed up on off stump, clipped back to the bowler
Tredwell to Hughes, 1 run played forward again, dropped to cover point for a quick single
Tredwell to Bailey, no run a step down the wicket and defended with the pad
Tredwell to Bailey, no run goes to paddle sweep and misses, struck outside the line
Tredwell to Bailey, 2 runs goes for the paddle sweep and gets it away this time, square leg has to run back to field
Tredwell to Bailey, no run stays back to guide from just outside off stump to short third man
Bresnan to Hughes, no run just outside off, driven at and doesn't time it to short extra cover
Bresnan to Hughes, 1 wide bumper down the leg side, a very rare poor ball
Bresnan to Hughes, no run a flash to a full ball well wide of off stump, misses by a distance
Bresnan to Hughes, 1 run back of a length around off stump, clipped through square leg
Bresnan to Bailey, no run a foot and a half outside the off stump, played off the back foot to cover
Bresnan to Bailey, no run tighter line and Bailey takes it high on the bat and drops it towards midwicket
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run goes to pull and gets it off the high on the bat out towards deep midwicket, good job he didn't catch that better in the end
Tredwell to Bailey, no run tossed up outside off stump, Bailey advances and clips straight to midwicket
Tredwell to Bailey, no run pushed through around the off, tapped back down the pitch
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run floated up, edges across, manages to paddle the ball through backward square
Tredwell to Hughes, 2 runs round the wicekt, drifts on to the pads, tickled through square leg and they run hard, Hughes beating the arm back for a second

Tredwell to Hughes, no run is that a missed stumping? The ball turned and bounced sharply as Tredwell played across the line, he stumbled out of his crease but Buttler couldn't react quickly enough to grab it
Tredwell to Hughes, no run tossed up around off, blocked into the off side
Bresnan to Bailey, no run tight line and Bailey gets across to defend a length delivery
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run angling in from wide of the stumps, steered through gully for a single
Bresnan to Hughes, 1 run leg-stump line, rising off a length and nudged through square leg
Bresnan to Bailey, no run length ball, around the line of off, pushed back towards mid-on
Bresnan to Bailey, 2 runs bit of width, Bailey angles the bat and steers behind point, third man has to run round and they pick up two
Bresnan to Bailey, no run pitched up in the channel outside off, driven with a full swing of the arms but straight to mid-off
Root to Hughes, 1 run round the wicket, tossed up outside off, driven through the covers to the sweeper
Root to Bailey, no run over the wicket, floated up and played back to the bowler
Root to Bailey, 1 run full and straight, pitching around off, worked off the pads through midwicket
Root to Hughes, no run round the wicket again, tapped back down the track
Root to Hughes, no run skips forward and tries to drive a length ball, sends it back to the bowler again
Root to Hughes, 1 run wheesh, another half-chance, Hughes trying to manufacture a lofted drive, the ball drops just short of Bell at mid-off
Bopara to Hughes, 1 run on the stumps, worked wide of mid-on, good firm connection but Alastair Cook leaps like a tiger on the edge of the circle to keep them to one
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run angling in from outside off, clipped into the off side
Bopara to Hughes, no run pushed towards the covers
Bopara to Hughes, 1 run full and on leg stump, Hughes is one one leg clipping flamboyantly through midwicket
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run slightly shorty of a length and wide of the stumps, hacked through cover point to the sweeper
Bopara to Hughes, no run pitched up on middle and leg, comes off the inside half of the back and rolls into the leg side, Bopara fields
Root to Bailey, 1 run tossed up, pushed back through mid-on and there's a comfortable one
Root to Hughes, 1 run gets forward and tickles one through the covers
Root to Bailey, 2 runs full and straight, good work from Bailey, showing his stumps but adroitly paddling the ball through 45 for a couple
Root to Bailey, no run floated up outside off, reverses the hands but can't beat point
Root to Bailey, 1 run pushed through on the stumps, worked with a closed bat face through midwicket
Root to Hughes, no run round the wicket, floated up and tapped into the covers
Bopara to Bailey, 2 runs touch short and straight, pulled in front of deep midwicket and they get back for a second
Bopara to Bailey, FOUR runs drops short again and Bailey times this one better, swivel-pulling hard and flat through square, nearly taking a chunk out of the umpire in the process
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run gets forward and digs out a full ball back down the ground
Bopara to Hughes, FOUR runs easy paced half-volley on middle stump and Hughes latches on to it quickly to loft towards long-on for a one-bounce four
Bopara to Hughes, 1 run on the stumps, worked through square
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run pitched up in the blockhole again, squeezed out towards long-on again
Root to Bailey, 1 run tossed up on middle, clips one through backward square
Root to Hughes, 1 run on the stumps, worked through midwicket
Root to Bailey, 1 run slightly shorter, stands up in the crease and knocks one through mid-on
Root to Hughes, 1 run full and wide of the stumps, gets forward and dribbles one through cover point
Root to Bailey, 1 run angled in, full and glanced through square leg for another single
Root to Hughes, no run floated up in the channel outside off, punched on the front foot but well stopped at cover
Broad to Bailey, no run slightly back of a length, homing in over the top of the stumps, blocked towards mid-on
Broad to Bailey, no run this is perilously close to being played on, as the ball seams - reverses? - back in a Bailey, cramps him for room and he chops into the ground and up, over the stumps
Broad to Bailey, 1 run bit of width, length delivery and steered off the back foot through point
Broad to Hughes, 1 run back of a length, Hughes hops into position to pull flat through square leg
Broad to Bailey, 1 leg bye Broad is interested here, the ball again coming back at Bailey, he's hit above knee - quite leg side too - and they pick up an extra as Erasmus shakes his head
Broad to Hughes, no run a swing and a miss from Hughes, who's aiming over extra cover but is beaten outside off
Root to Bailey, 1 run reverses the hands and paddles one through the square on the off side
Root to Hughes, no run opens the face and slides a full ball towards backward point
Root to Hughes, no run tossed up and driven hard straight to the man at extra cover - another dot

Root to Hughes, OUT skids on, Hughes plays an ugly swipe across the line and is hit in front - Dharmasena gives it! That was a horrible shot from Hughes, he was getting tied down by Root's gentle offies, he tried to pull the ball off a length and was struck in front of middle and leg
Root to Voges, 1 run over the wicket, tossed up outside off, gets forward to steer one square
Root to Bailey, 1 run on the stumps and nudged for one to backward square leg
Broad to Bailey, no run slightly back of a length, defended short on the leg side
Broad to Bailey, 1 run angling back in off a length, worked through square leg off the pads
Broad to Voges, 1 run full and straight, again turned to leg for a single
Broad to Bailey, no run off-stump line, on a length, played back to the bowler
Broad to Bailey, 1 run in the channel outside off, gets forward and pushes into the covers, a rare misfield gives them one
Broad to Voges, no run good length, shaping in towards middle, worked straight to the man at midwicket
Root to Bailey, 1 run leaves the crease and looks to hit down the ground, ends up lofting a single short of long-on
Root to Voges, no run flat and going on with the arm, played back to the bowler from in front of the stumps
Root to Voges, 1 run drifts down the leg side, glanced through backward square for one
Root to Bailey, 1 run pushed through, opens the face and plays wide of point, good running rotates the strike again
Root to Voges, no run turned off the pads towards midwicket, where it is smartly stopped
Root to Voges, 1 run floated up full and wide of the stumps, punched through the covers to the sweeper
Anderson to Voges, no run good length and angling in, defended square on the off side
Anderson to Voges, 1 run goes back and across steers a single through the infield towards deep cover
Anderson to Bailey, 1 run waits on a length ball and steers one behind square
Anderson to Voges, no run full and tailing in, gets forward to block
Anderson to Voges, no run pitched up in the channel outside off, Voges steps out and toes the ball towards extra cover
Anderson to Voges, no run beaten groping forward in the corridor, just enough seam movement off the pitch to take the ball past Voges' outside edge
Tredwell to Bailey, no run tossed up outside off, spinning in and Bailey misses stepping across and trying to paddle fine
Tredwell to Bailey, 2 runs gets forward and works a couple into a gap through square on the leg side, playing with the spin
Tredwell to Bailey, 2 runs tossed up high, waits and flicks behind deep square, again they come back for two
Tredwell to Bailey, FOUR runs plays the reverse sweep again and times this one really well, the bat coming down in a hard arc and pinging the ball past short third man and away for four
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run takes the pace off a bit more, tossed up outside off, punched to long-on
Tredwell to Voges, 1 run floated up around off stump, nudges another single back past the bowler

Anderson to Voges, no run full and tailing in towards off stump, defended into the floor and Anderson gets a hand on it in his follow through, the ball loops up, hits the wicket at the non-striker's end ... and breaks a stump
Anderson to Voges, no run good length ball around off stump, blocked firmly back to the bowler
Anderson to Voges, 1 run length delivery, pushed towards cover, another slightly sloppy bit of fielding gives away a single
Anderson to Bailey, no run zips this one through off the seam and beats Bailey's outside edge as he fences from the crease - good ball, that
Anderson to Bailey, no run goes across and defends in front of the stumps
Anderson to Bailey, no run off-stump line, angling back off the pitch, blocked into the covers - just one off the over
Tredwell to Voges, FOUR runs Voges follows his captain's lead, reversing the hands and swiping the ball hard past the man on the edge of the ring for another boundary to third man
Tredwell to Voges, 2 runs floated up outside off stump, goes across and deftly flicks the ball fine on the leg side
Tredwell to Voges, no run length ball, around off stump, defended with bat and pad back to the bowler
Tredwell to Voges, 1 run tossed up on the stumps, tickled down the ground for a single to long-on
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run pitching middle and leg, worked wide of midwicket for one more
Tredwell to Voges, no run full and flighted, drifting across outside off, punched back and Tredwell fields off his own bowling
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run good length, around the line of off, blocked short on the off side and they amble one
Bresnan to Voges, 1 run touch wider, Voges opens his shoulders and hits aggressively into the covers, again they pick up a single
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run coming back in off a length, brings the bat down at an angle and squeezes one behind square on the leg side

Bresnan to Voges, OUT Voges swings, misses and is bowled, Bresnan strikes for England! Looked like a little offcutter, rolling his fingers over the ball and it jinked back just enough off the pitch as Voges tried to hit down the ground, beat the bat on the inside and clattered into the top of middle and off stump
Bresnan to Marsh, no run slightly back of a length, stays in the crease and jabs at it defensively
Bresnan to Marsh, no run beaten, prodding without any foot movement at a length delivery in the channel
Broad to Bailey, 1 run slightly short and outside off, Bailey guides a single down to third man
Broad to Marsh, no run good line and length, Marsh goes back and blocks in front of off stump
Broad to Marsh, no run slightly fuller, angled in and Marsh drives off the back foot into the ground, it's caught by short cover running across and the crowd cheers, not realising it was a bump ball
Broad to Marsh, no run full of a good length, coming back around off stump, blocked towards point
Broad to Marsh, no run maintains that probing length, Marsh covers the line
Broad to Marsh, no run parsimonious stuff from Broad, targeting the stumps, Marsh can't get forward and defends into the off side
Bresnan to Bailey, no run good length, zipping back in from outside off, Bailey's cramped but keeps it out
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run pitched up and played back on the leg side for a single
Bresnan to Marsh, no run length ball around the line of off, defended
Bresnan to Marsh, FOUR runs short and down the leg side - hello, Mitchell Marsh, he rocks back cobra-fast and cracks a pull shot to the deep backward square boundary
Bresnan to Marsh, no run back into block mode, defending in front of the stumps
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run slightly full, tailing in on off stump, closes the face and clips wide of mid-on for a hasty single

Anderson to Marsh, OUT back of a length and pushed off the back foot straight to point and Anderson becomes the highest wicket-taker in one-day cricket for England. A loose stroke from Marsh outside off, it went at a good catchable height, very quickly but straight to Morgan who clung on at chest height with two hands, a sharp grab
Anderson to Wade, 1 run full ball the swings slightly into the pads, Wade gets a back down onto it and turns it down to long leg
Anderson to Bailey, 1 run full of length just outside off, dabbed to point coming forward, just in front of the fielder so they take a quick single
Anderson to Wade, no run this slides away from Wade who get a little squared up defending on off stump towards cover
Anderson to Wade, no run blocked just outside off stump now, again into the covers from the crease

Anderson to Wade, OUT full and sliding past the outside edge, taken by the keeper and given out! Umpire Dharmasena nodded his head for the edge, they're going to check whether it carried to Buttler. There was no hesitation from Buttler who threw it up straight away, Hot Spot confirms a thin edge too, there was a nervy look behind by Wade as it went past
Bresnan to Bailey, 2 runs length ball on middle stump, flicked around the corner backward of square and that will bring up George Bailey's fifty, a lone hand in this chase
Bresnan to Bailey, no run tighter line to off stump and blocked back up the wicket
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run back of a length just outside off, late cut down to third man
Bresnan to Faulkner, no run full length on off stump, blocked forward up on the off side
Bresnan to Faulkner, no run blocked around the off stump towards the on side getting a bit squared up
Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run full length, tails in again and is worked through square leg
Tredwell to Faulkner, 5 runs floated up on off stump, tucked to midwicket, lazy from 12th man Bairstow, who then throws at the stumps and no-one is backing up and that's four buzzards too
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run dropped into midwicket, wide enough of the fielder for a comfortable single
Tredwell to Faulkner, 1 leg bye goes to paddle sweep from off stump, struck on the pad outside the line
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run around the wicket, tucked through square leg on the front foot
Tredwell to Faulkner, no run slider and it beats Bailey on the outside edge playing forward
Tredwell to Faulkner, no run full just outside off, clipped back to the bowler
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run full on leg stump, poor ball but gets away with it as it's clipped straight to short long leg
Bopara to Faulkner, no run full ball on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
Bopara to Faulkner, no run full ball on the stumps, tucked straight to midwicket again
Bopara to Faulkner, no run length ball, back and across the off stump played back to the bowler
Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run full length again, this a little wider allowing Faulkner to drive out to deep cover
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run squeezed out from a full length to short long leg, a shy at the stumps but they're through for the single quickly

Tredwell to Bailey, OUT around the wicket again, a few steps down the track, tries to take on long on but doesn't get anywhere near the proper connection and Joe Root takes the catch a very easy chance going a few yards to his left. It was a weak shot from Bailey and looped very comfortably to the fielder, Australia's last hope, if there was still hope,
Tredwell to Faulkner, no run flicked off the middle stump to square leg

Tredwell to Faulkner, 1 run flicked to midwicket and they take a quick run, there's a dive back in as the throw comes in from Morgan at midwicket, Buttler takes it very well and turns with his gloves backwards to the stumps having dived past the timbers and I think Johnson is short of his ground, the bat is over the line but in the air and I reckon the b
Tredwell to Johnson, 1 run pushed from off stump on the front foot back to the bowler
Tredwell to Faulkner, 1 run full length on the stumps, pushed down the ground to long-on
Tredwell to Johnson, no run ran back up the wicket from a full length again
Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run full length wide of the off stump, cracked to mid-off
Bopara to Johnson, 1 leg bye full of length that swings back into the pads, brief cry for lbw but it's pitched outside leg stump, it cannons down to third man
Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run slower ball on the stumps, Faulkner backs away and waits for it before chopping behind square on the leg side
Bopara to Johnson, 2 runs powerfully driven off a full length on the stumps, gets it wide of long-on and they get a couple
Bopara to Johnson, 3 runs another slower ball, this is spotted and pulled just behind square, Anderson slides and saves the boundary, fine sliding effort
Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run full, slightly inswinging yorker, dug out down the ground to long-on
Tredwell to Faulkner, SIX runs tossed up from around the wicket onto middle and leg and hammered over midwicket with a fine slog sweep, excellent stroke
Tredwell to Faulkner, 2 runs goes down the ground now and strikes it well again, gets it pretty flat, long-on slides around and saves well
Tredwell to Faulkner, no run gives himself room but can only get a length ball back up the wicket
Tredwell to Faulkner, 1 run dragged down a little and pulled out to deep midwicket
Tredwell to Johnson, no run turn away from the attempted lofted on-drive, feet went nowhere and he missed it by a long strecth
Tredwell to Johnson, 1 run steps back and cuts hard, Bell half-saves at cover but they get a single
Bopara to Johnson, no run around the wicket, slower ball on the stumps, swung at, miles too soon with the stroke, gets an inside edge past the stumps
Bopara to Johnson, 1 run full on the stumps, slugged down to long-on
Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run slower ball on the stumps again, half-pulled through midwicket for a single into the deep

Bopara to Johnson, OUT full toss comes off high on the bat and loops to point. Oh dear Mitchell, a waist-high full toss, he's tried to slug it over the off side but is too late on the stroke and chipped up an easy catch to Morgan, they umpires had a quick check for the height of the delivery but concurred that it was fine

Bopara to Faulkner, no run full ball on the stumps, pushed back to the bower who takes the catch, surely a bump ball and they're going to check again! How many reviews have we seen today? I though Bopara was appealing as a joke but Erasmus has decided to go upstairs. He's smashed it into the floor!
Bopara to Faulkner, FOUR runs another slower ball, waited for and cut hard backward of point, well played that and gets it down to third man rope
Tredwell to Starc, 1 run full ball pushed back to the bowler but Tredwell lets it get away from him
Tredwell to Faulkner, 1 run back in the crease, clipped through square leg
Tredwell to Starc, no run full ball on the stumps, Tredwell gets down to it and it cannons into the stumps
Tredwell to Starc, 2 runs forced away from middle and off wide of mid-on with a bit of a slog
Tredwell to Starc, no run back and pushed from off stump to extra cover
Tredwell to Starc, 1 run forward and pushed past extra cover this time and gets a single down to long-off
Anderson to Starc, 1 run full and swinging into the pads, runs into midwicket
Anderson to Faulkner, FOUR runs full and on leg stump, clipped down very fine on the leg side
Anderson to Faulkner, 1 run full ball, clipped to midwicket, whose right on the edge of the circle
Anderson to Starc, no run length ball, pushed at outside off, a genuine edge but short of Buttler who takes it going to his left
Anderson to McKay, 1 run full and this shapes slightly away from a press forward that gets a thick outside edge to Cook's right at slip, it didn't carry to him but it saved at least a run
Broad to McKay, no run full just outside off, a forward press to extra cover
Broad to McKay, no run a little straighter and a touch shorter, played from the crease to midwicket
Broad to McKay, 1 run similar delivery but McKay gets inside the line a bit more and tucks down to long leg
Broad to Faulkner, 1 run very full on off stump, driven back towards the bowler, Broad gets a foot in the way but the ball runs behind the stumps and they get a single
Broad to McKay, no run good bumper, McKay gets under it well
Broad to McKay, 1 run full on off stump, pushed gently wide of mid-off for a comfortable single
Anderson to McKay, no run full just outside off, played forward and pushed to extra cover who dives to his right and saves the single
Anderson to McKay, 1 run played off the back foot down to long-on from just outside off stump
Anderson to Faulkner, 1 run length ball on the stumps, kept out with bat and pad, it drops into the on side and they take a quick run
Anderson to McKay, no run full ball on off stump, pushed down the ground, the bowler fields
Anderson to McKay, no run going for the inswinging yorker is Anderson, kept out towards extra-cover by McKay
Anderson to McKay, no run a touch straighter, take a good chunk of the boot and runs to Buttler's left where he runs across to field
Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run full on the stumps, flicked to short long leg where
Bresnan to McKay, no run just back of a length outside off, pushed at on the back foot and missed
Bresnan to McKay, no run off stump delivery, blocked up the wicket back to Bresnan
Bresnan to McKay, 1 run a foot and a half outside off, guided down to third man
Bresnan to Faulkner, no run back of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover
Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run a little straighter, gets inside the line and tucks down to long leg
Broad to Faulkner, 1 run a foot outside off stump, Faulkner steps outside leg stump and chops down to third man, and, aha, the 200 comes up
Broad to McKay, 1 run full on the stumps, punched hard down to long-on
Broad to Faulkner, FOUR runs too straight and clipped past the short long leg, a very rare loose delivery
Broad to Faulkner, 1 run length ball on the stumps, Faulkner steps away and cracks a ball hard to point, Morgan fumbles so they get a run
Broad to McKay, 1 leg bye blocked with the pad on the stumps, it drops at his feet and gets called through for a quick single
Broad to Faulkner, 1 run full on the stumps, calmly flicked down to long-on
Bresnan to Faulkner, (no ball) FOUR runs looked very high was it a beamer? It was, an edged down very fine past the keeper too
Bresnan to Faulkner, FOUR runs steps to leg and slaps it past extra-cover, lovely stroke and Faulkner goes to 50, at least he's had a good day
Bresnan to Faulkner, no run gets down low to paddle sweep but misses and it goes over leg stump to the keeper
Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run blocked on the stumps into the covers, finds a gap
Bresnan to McKay, 1 run a touch straight and clipped down to long leg
Bresnan to Faulkner, 2 runs slower ball on the stumps, waited for and slugged down to long-on
Bresnan to Faulkner, no run finishes with a bumper and that's that

Fine performance with the ball from England and they have won by 48 runs, a very comfortable victory in the end. They would have been nervous after a sluggish effort with the bat that saw them fall 20 or 30 runs short of what many though was par in good batting conditions. England lost their power hitters cheaply and Ravi Bopara was needed to prop up their tota

For Australia, that was a very disappointing second innings. They started very quietly and then lost wickets, the worst of the worst. Thereafter only George Bailey got stuck in and made a score and by the time James Faulkner knocked it around down the order it was too late. It looked an out-of-form order lacking in quality. They have a real job on their hands t
Man of the Match goes to Ian Bell for his top-score of the day, 91 in 115 balls. He led England's innings very well.

That's it from Edgbaston, England underway with a win and now have a few days to take stock, their next game comes on Thursday against Sri Lanka in Cardiff. A day before that fixture, Australia play their next game, that's against New Zealand back in Birmingham again. Tomorrow it's down to Cardiff for the second match in Group A, Sri Lanka and New Zealand getti
England won by 48 runs
Player of the match is Ian Bell, ENG
